data.title: Classy Steak Place in DTC
data.text:
I'm not sure that we needed another steakhouse in DTC, but this newer small steakhouse chain is awesome! Great prix fixe and a la carte menus, with only the best cuts of favorite proteins. 

The wine selection is very sophisticated, and the house made desserts are amazing!

The grandiose decor is very fun too.

data.title: Great ambiance, good food, spotty management
data.text: When it first opened, this chain restaurant was very impressive.  Top-notch servers, chefs, management.  But as they changed, so did the quality.  Now these things vary.  Overall, it is still good.  Interior is fantastic.  A good choice for a special occasion.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Had a great dinner. Friendly staff and perfectly-cooked New York strip made for a wonderful evening. The carrot cake was delicious (and huge!).

data.title: Good food and great service
data.text: This is a very large restaurant with ample spacious seating. Ambiance is that of a fine dining eatery. The food was good, had the steaks and some sides including the creamed spinach, cauliflower and truffle fries. The steaks were of high quality, best eaten medium rare or rare in my opinion. The barbeque shrimp were great too, the size of each shrimp being almost the size of a small chicken leg. Service was excellent, impeccable. Obviously on the pricier side, however did not feel cheated at all.

data.title: Good, not great steakhouse
data.text: I went here with some friends the other night and don't really have any complaints, although I would say the interior is a more like and upscale Luby's Cafeteria than a typical steakhouse.  We had the Barbeque Shrimp Bacon-wrapped, horseradish, Southern Comfort barbeque sauce to start.  It was pretty good, but you get 4 and for $23 I'd say definitely skip it.  I then had The Merlot Iceberg Iceberg lettuce wedge, chopped eggs, bacon, tomato, red onion rings which was suitable, not great.  For dinner I had the Ribeye which again, was pretty good but certainly nothing to right home about.  I like a nice crust on my steak and even ordered it this way, which it did not have.  We al split the Brussels Sprouts and Lobster Mashed Potatoes.  The potatoes were very disappointing.  Our meal certainly wasn't bad and if I had to go back and someone else was paying I would happily attend.  But if I am going to a steakhouse there are simply better options available.

data.title: Maybe Best Steak Ever
data.text: Here for a free meal with a financial presentation.  It was amazing and we can't wait to go back--even if we have to pay ourselves.

data.title: Great Service and Facility but average food
data.text:
Had a discount coupon so we decided to try it.  Picked a slow night as there was a Bronco preseason game.  Every person from the greeters to the wait staff were excellent.  Friendly, courteous and knowledgeable.  Our waiter, Neil, discovered it was our first time and spent considerable time explaining the foundings of the chain, the menu, the decor, and the positive aspects of the food.  We selecteditems on their special summer menu which include a salad, entre, and desert.  

Jill had the crab cakes and I had the sirloin medallions.  Filling portions but neither of us was excited by the quality.  It was fine but nothing special.  Perhaps the higher priced protein would be better but way too much food for us.  Will say the mustard and the red wine sauces for my steak were very good.

data.title: A very different high-end steak and seafood restaurant
data.text: The interior is beautifully decorated.  The tables are not crammed together.  It is well lite and the staff is very friendly.  The menu is large and the wine list extensive.  The calamari appetizer is a huge portion.  The steaks are great.

data.title: Ok, but nothing special
data.text: I went here last week with a colleague and had a good meal, but it wasn't anything special.  Service was excellent, however our steaks were only "good."  They set themselves up as a premium steak house, however the food doesn't distinguish them from any of the other premium steakhouses such Flemings. Certainly not a bad meal, but not craving my next visit.

data.title: Great for a group event
data.text: Excellent atmosphere, great food and attentive service; I would go again on my own.  The sea bass was tender and delicious; fine dining worth experiencing.

data.title: Beautiful restaurant...the decor is pretty expensive...
data.text:
Eddie Merlot's is a small steakhouse chain out of the Midwest.  Beautiful decor...very pricey.   We went on a July Sunday evening.  Not hungry enough to jump into one of the $40 to 50 steak entress, I selected a twin sirloin medallion special for around $39.  I selected a tomato and onion salad and Creme brûlée to go with it. (Salad, entree and dessert were included with the special.)  Sirloin's always a gamble.  I've had very good cuts...I've had very tough grisly cuts.  Tonight was not my lucky night.  Both medallions were tough.  The tomato and onion salad was good.  The Creme brûlée was tasty but prepared ahead of time and served cold.
This may have just been an off night but, with so many good restaurants, I probably won't go back and gamble more trying a pricier steak.  It was a slow Sunday evening...maybe they schedule the second team on that night.

data.title: Excellent Food
data.text: We ate here recently for our anniversary and weren't disappointed! We ordered the lobster bisque and tuna for appetizers and they were amazing. We both ordered the filet's and they were cooked perfectly. For dessert, we ordered the chocolate cake and it was enough to feed 4 people!  We had to take home what we couldn't finish and enjoyed it the next day.  The service was excellent and the food was served at appropriate intervals. We will definitely eat here again in the future.

data.title: Another perfect evening at Eddie Merlot's
data.text: I've been to EB's several times. It's always a wonderful experience with fantastic service. Tonight we had their 'summer trio' with Salmon and Filet Mignon with a Caesar Salad, and Strawberry Shortcake for Dessert. Nothing could have been better. Our server was new but as fantastic as the others. Her trainee 'shadow' Christina was also very pleasant and seemed to be quickly getting up to speed. Linda went above and beyond and got the approval for a variance on the special that we requested. Thanks to the manager it was approved.

data.title: Excellent Wines by the Glass
data.text:
Tried for the first time the other night and was surprised to learn it was happy hour. I was shown all drinks and food that were $3 off until 7p.

They have a very good wine list, and I was happy to see that even good and great wine were available by the glass. Food was decent but nothing too special.

I was disappointed to receive my bill and find that none of the food or drink I ordered included the $3 off. I was too lazy and it was too busy to dispute it but essentially paid $21 more than I should.

data.title: Beautiful dining room
data.text:
Very good food, excellent service! 
Hubby had bison and loved it! I had lobster tail,  yum yum!  Great sides, creamy spinach,  & caramelized onions and mushrooms.  Cream Brule was excellent.

data.title: A 5-Star Experience
data.text:
I took my son and his wife to Eddie Merlot's to celebrate a birthday.

From the moment we walked in the door, all employees were very welcoming and attentive. 

When my daughter-in-law was unsure about which wine to choose, our server (Sean) gladly provided three samples. Sean was sure to describe all the specials for evening and answered all our questions regarding preparation and ingredients.

My son and I had the filets. They were excellent - easily on a par with those at the Capital Grille or Del Frisco's. My daughter-in-law loved her pork chop, and it was prepared exactly as she ordered. Salads were fresh and tasty, a side of sweet potatoes was marvelous, and desserts were delicious without being cloyingly sweet.

We completed our meal with after-dinner drinks (try Eddie Merlot's coffee. It is quite unique.), and left knowing we had experienced a fine and special meal.

data.title: Best of the Chains and I have eaten at almost all of them.
data.text: I have eaten here a couple of times now and I can say that Eddie's serves a superb steak.  It is slightly better than any of the other large or small chains (Fleming's, Ruth's, Morton's Capital Grille) that I have ever eaten.  I would put it on par with the last steak I had a the Palm in DC which was just superb.  Service is impeccable and attentive, but not overly so (bothersome) and all of the staff from the hostess to the server to the water glass filler were all very friendly and engaging.  Kudos to Eddie's for a superb meal once again.

data.title: Excellent Meal - Great Salmon!!!
data.text: Very attentive staff, excellent food and wine selection.  I had the salmon, with some sauce, and it was heavenly.  Paired with a dry, light sav blanc.  Huge piece of chocolate cake for dessert.  Simply marvelous!!!

data.title: Sunday wine special enhances your dining experience
data.text:
My wife and I invited her sister to join us at Eddie Merlot's, because she is also (with my wife) an artist and would enjoy all the huge mosaic and stained glass pieces in the restaurant, as well as the ambiance in the main dining room. And she did. My wife and I have dined here before and liked the food. Last night was no exception. Our server Darylynn answered our questions about the menu and made helpful suggestions for us.

There was a spring fixed price menu, but we opted for the regular menu. We dined on sea bass, the prime NY strip (dry-aged, I suspect), with beet and spinach salads. For side dishes, we ordered sweet potato casserole (excellent!), mac & cheese (yummy!), and broccoli. The food was very good. For dessert, we went with key lime pie and carrot cake (can be easily shared by 4 people) a la mode.

On Sundays, Eddie Merlot's has a wine special. For any wine served by the glass, you can get a full bottle at half price. So, we enjoyed a bottle of Ghost Pines Zinfandel Blend at a substantial savings. It was also a perfect complement to the steak.

data.title: Another great experience at Eddie's
data.text: You can't beat the service and food at Eddie's. Yes it has a high price point but you never feel uncomfortable or hurried. We brought a couple that had never been there and they fell in love with it. I had the Filet's three ways you won't believe the flavors.
